cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic, then turning northwest toward the southeastern U.S. coast (Carolinas) late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeastern North Carolina coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern and mid-Atlantic coasts from South Carolina northward through Virginia and the Chesapeake Bay region, including Maryland
weather_observation.wind: Baltimore could experience sporadic tropical-storm-force gusts (34–45 kt) late Thursday night into Friday as Florence’s circulation moves inland and northward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay if the track brings strong onshore flow into the estuary.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Friday into Saturday could produce several inches of rain and localized fresh-water flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated waves and dangerous rip currents in Chesapeake Bay, possible river flooding impacting port logistics.
